title: Here's a reading list of 20 articles up to 2023 on summarizing written and spoken conversations. These articles cover various aspects of summarization, including techniques, models, and applications
Pre-training of Deep Bidirectional Transformers for Language Understanding"** - Devlin et al
Pre-training with Extracted Gap-sentences for Abstractive Summarization"** - Zhang et al
**"Exploring the Limits of Transfer Learning with a Unified Text-to-Text Transformer"**
**"DialogLM: Pre-trained Model for Long Dialogue Summarization"** - Zhang et al
**"Summarizing Dialogues with Dialogue Act Labels and Summarization Networks"**
**"Hierarchical Attention Networks for Document Classification"** - Yang et al
**"A Survey on Recent Approaches for Natural Language Processing in Low-Resource Scenarios"**
**"Towards Abstractive Summarization Using Semantic Representations"** - Liu et al
**"Abstractive Summarization of Spoken and Written Conversations Based on Deep Learning"**
**"A Deep Reinforced Model for Abstractive Summarization"** - Paulus et al
**"Neural Abstractive Text Summarization with Sequence-to-Sequence Models"** - Chopra et al

container-title: **"Discourse-Aware Neural Extractive Text Summarization"** - Xu et al

title: **"A Comprehensive Survey on Dialogue Summarization: Recent Advances and New Frontiers"**
**"Multi-Document Summarization Using Sentence Graphs"** - Erkan and Radev
**"Extractive Summarization Using Multi-Task Learning with Document Classification"**

container-title: **"Abstractive Summarization with Attentive Recurrent Neural Networks"** - Nallapati et al

title: **"Summarizing Long and Complex Documents with Deep Learning"**
**"Towards a Better Understanding of the Transferability of Pre-trained Language Models for Abstractive Summarization"**
These articles should provide a comprehensive overview of the current state of research in summarizing both written and spoken conversations
